metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12028 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An Incorrect Access Control vulnerability in SpawningKit in Phusion Passenger 5.3.x before 5.3.2 allows a Passenger-managed malicious application, upon spawning a child process, to report an arbitrary different PID back to Passenger's process manager. If the malicious application then generates an error, it would cause Passenger's process manager to kill said reported arbitrary PID.

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> xenial, bionic, focal and impish have version 5.0.x and are not affected because the issue was introduced in 5.3.0, with a major overhaul in SpawningKit.

criterions.comment: ruby-passenger: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
